website_summaries.verdict: This is a durable, flexible, and adaptable inspection camera made to handle all situations, and most importantly, it sports an unexpectedly high-resolution camera for the low entry price.
pros: Includes mirror, hook, and magnet head tools
Connects to iOS and Android via WiFi
cons: Unfortunately, this model’s companion app is only compatible with iOS devices that are running 8.0 or newer

customer_reviews.title: Examine all the holes!
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly nice quality, effectiveness, ease of use, and decent camera. I purchased for the specific purpose of examining floor joists of a pier and beam foundation home via a hole in the sub floor. Afterwards I ended up walking around my home looking for dark holes to stick my 'lil camera just to see inside because I could. Very happy with this little camera and would recommend to anyone who needs to inspect something that is not immediately accessible.
customer_reviews.author: A Green Bean

customer_reviews.title: Great idea. Picture quality is poor. Not very useful. - 10m long model
customer_reviews.text: This is for the 10m long model. Ideally, this camera would be used for small spaces that you either can't see or reach otherwise. Unfortunately, the focus length doesn't allow it to work like this. We bought this to troubleshoot leaky HVAC lines. It didn't work for three reasons. 1) The lights aren't bright enough (it was fully charged) 2) The cable just bunched up on itself after getting about 6' into the duct 3) Anything not at the exact distance and directly in front of the camera is too blurry to be useful, if you can even see because of the dim light.
customer_reviews.author: draftsit

customer_reviews.title: Picture quality is excellent for my application (pipe inspection at short distances).
customer_reviews.text: The first endoscope unit delivered would not turn on the video or picture features. Troubleshooting via email did not produce results that fixed the problem. The unit was replaced within two days and I was able to operate it as I had expected for my application. BlueFire did an excellent job being very responsive to my concerns.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Chilton

customer_reviews.title: Basically junk, but you should expect that give the price
customer_reviews.text: Basically, this is a low resolution camera (VGA resolution at best) poor dynamic range camera. But to expect better at this price range is not realistic. Photos are grainy with washed out colors, with very poor resolution. Much much worse than a low end web cam, more like a 1990's VGA camera. It's better than no camera wedged into a tight space, but not much. So if you buy it, do so with your eyes open & expectations low.
customer_reviews.author: AccurateCritic

customer_reviews.title: I would really like to be able to write a full fledged review ...
customer_reviews.text: I would really like to be able to write a full fledged review but I can't. After a full charge cycle the battery dies in 30 seconds or less. This test has been repeated multiple times after full charge cycles. However, during those 30 seconds of functionality I can say that a grainy, out of focus picture came across. Perhaps one could adjust it if it worked for more than 30 seconds at a time. Please save yourself the frustration and look elsewhere for a similar product.
customer_reviews.author: CJC

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product was terrible out of the box. Hardly connected to my phone. When it attempted to give me a picture it froze and I had to shut it off and restart the whole process over again. I would NEVER recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Kravenspeed

customer_reviews.title: unless your a software expert, beware...
customer_reviews.text: the instructions suck, written by someone who doesn't know English and then try's to be cheap with words, the app and the implementation takes incredible patience, the battery doesn't last longer than 6-8 minutes before your hooped and charging again. It took me 8 hours of fiddling before I figured it out, then it connected the first time and died, after charging it again, it then went 7 minutes...it's charging right now. They don't tell you the thing works as a wifi router and you have to reconnect the phone everytime...there's a lot wrong with the creators, morons comes to mind. But it's working...
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bruce

customer_reviews.title: This device performs as advertised, and is of very good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this camera already for at least one project (to see through a floor under a bathtub to determine if there is any water damage), and have two other projects for which this will really come in handy. Meanwhile one son has borrowed the camera and used it for two of his projects, and we are both quite pleased. We haven't tested to its fullest, but it is sturdy, reliable, and easy to use, and I am sure it is going to serve us well--- and at a great price, too.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Simple. It works.
customer_reviews.text: The camera/light/WiFi module are great. The tools are just OK. Don’t plan on the retaining ring to hold them. Tape them on or use a better, independent hook or magnet to do any retrieving. Actual image of a pacifier in HVAC duct. I later retrieved it with a piece of 8ga wire using the borescope as a stationary viewer.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Very useful snake camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this almost a year ago and have only had occasion to use it perhaps half a dozen times, but the product works just as advertised. I have snaked this product down a drain to find jewelery, into a "hidey hole gone amuck" where my mom lost a hidden house key, etc., and was able to retreive items and/or confirm those items were not there. This is very useful, albiet, seldomly used device. I also used it to help me snake a cable through a wall in my house which worked a little too flawlessly. Although I don't use it often, when I need it, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: JamesE

customer_reviews.title: Good, well made product if you can get the proper app and clear instructions.
customer_reviews.text: I like the camera and what it is capable of doing. Getting it to do what it does is the challenge! It’s not clear what or how to find the proper app. I finally figured it out after having to download a scanning app for the QR code. It worked for a few minutes and then stopped. I’m not sure why. I charged fully beforehand. The product itself seems sturdy and well made. I really hope it will work because there’s so much I can do this devise. Update: the app to use is HD WIFI. After, the camera worked.
customer_reviews.author: Busy homeschooling mom of 4

customer_reviews.title: Was not real good for heating /AC ductwork
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to view what might be clogging my AC/heat duct work in my home. I tried to extend it as far as it would go, but it is not rigid enough to do so. I also had to shine a powerful LED Flashlight down the ductwork to see anything. To be able to get the camera fully extended I bought a 50 foot drain snake ( more rigid ) to attach with electrical tape the Blue fire with hopes that will let me extend it further. Perhaps this product was not designed to do what I want it to that makes me give it a lower score / rating then what it deserves.
customer_reviews.author: PB

customer_reviews.title: Limited application due to flexing cable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this inspection camera hoping to insert it through appliances and cabinets specifically to discover where mice are accessing our modular home. I should have considered how difficult it would be to guide it; sort of like pushing a string. Some other reviewer advised taping it to a sewer snake, so I bought a new ten foot snake and duly taped the endoscope to it. Better, but still fairly worthless for my needs. I'll keep it, taped to my cable snake, and trust that someday I'll find an appropriate circumstance to use it. Setup was fairly straight forward, by following a previous reviewer's excellent translation from the original non-English speaking instruction.
customer_reviews.author: Alec

customer_reviews.title: What a GREAT camera and deal!
customer_reviews.text: You won't be disappointed with this purchase! Took me a minute to figure it out with my iPhone but in the end, you charge the camera, download the app to your phone using the QBR code. Once camera is charged, go to your setting and head to your WiFi and find the new WiFi to the camera and connect. Then go back to your app and you should see the live cam working. You can record and it goes to your iCloud or saves to your phone. The light on the camera can be adjusted to be bright or no light. Great great great, you will NOT be disappointed!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ziggyb1373

customer_reviews.title: I’m very disappointed, I’ll be returning it soon
customer_reviews.text: The blue fire controller was not working at all, even after I charged it for a very long time. Also my side mirror did not arrive along with the rest of my items. I’m very disappointed, I’ll be returning it soon.
customer_reviews.author: Yuki

customer_reviews.title: OK for the price - directions need an upgrade (see below)
customer_reviews.text: This wasn't as rigid as I thought it would be and the directions are horrible. I almost sent it back before coming here and finding another review that explains - you have to pair your phone with this unit. So go to your phone wifi settings and pair with the Jetion_xxxxxxxx wifi signal, put in the password of 12345678 and then it works. It could be brighter too (yes I turned up the brightness controls) For the money - it is just ok. I'll keep it but have had a better and cheaper camera in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Maisi

customer_reviews.title: Worked great to see sewer line
customer_reviews.text: After getting quotes for $350 and $500 to check our sewer line for leaks, we decided to try this camera instead. We needed to run a guide that was sturdier in order to push it through the pipes but once we got it in there, we got some great video. I recommend for easier to access areas. If you have to force it through a line, you’ll need to attach it to something first.
customer_reviews.author: Wendi Webber

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: The depth of field, and focus on this camera is surprisingly poor. The stiffness of the cable is about right for most applications...stiff enough to push down a hole but flexible enough to get around corners. The length of the rigid ends limits the corners you can get around though. I tried to get around a corner in 1-1/4" PVC and it had a hard time. Interface with an iPad was fairly easy but I had serious problems with adware on the Android app download. Overall not impressed, and I'd probably look for something better next time.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Works, not great though.
customer_reviews.text: Update: this camera is terrible. I tried to check out my HVAC lines, and the camera is completely useless. The wire is too rigid to make any turns in the duct, only making it in about 3 feet. I wish it wasn’t too late to return it. As a camera, it works ok. Don’t expect to have any control over the movement of the lens. You can sort of maneuver it slightly, but after a few feet it’s basically just shoving it in an hoping it goes where you want it. And forget trying to get it through more than 5 feet or so of corrugated pipe. It just gets hung up.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Not worth
customer_reviews.text: If you reset the camera through the app you might need to force close the app, and then clear its data and restart the camera or restart the app. It isn't polished at all. camera quality is pretty terrible. if you're using this in a pipe it'll be useless even if the pipe is clear. the semi rigidity of the cable isn't useful for pipe inspecting either. do not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Ampersand

customer_reviews.title: doesn't stay straight - useless for my task
customer_reviews.text: This thing is probably fine for what it costs except that the wire has a permanent set to it. It curls back up within a minute or two no matter how hard you try to straighten it. You could probably push it down a pipe ok, but if you want to say inspect a boat bilge - useless. I will most likely be returning this product. It also has a few of the dialog boxes in the ap that only show up in Chinese even on the English version of the App and is generally of very poor engineering.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Kaiser

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, great price!
customer_reviews.text: Having rental properties we are constantly having to inspect drain lines for clogs, look for leaks in walls, inspect potential termite damage and the list goes on! We looked at cameras that sold for $200-500 with only a 5-10 foot lead and then we found this. WOW! We now have two of them, one 30ft and one 50ft, paying less than $60 for each of them and use them with our iPhones and iPads! Can capture still pics or video and send them to the plumber or pest control, saving both time and money! What a great camera!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Connection Very Intermittent
customer_reviews.text: Pairs easily with your phone over WiFi, or so it seams. Didn’t work consistently enough for me. I bought this camera to inspect a 1.5” PVC pipe. The wire is pretty flimsy, but I did manage to fish it down my pipe. My main issue with this product was that every time I got it connected to the WiFi and streaming video, I’d start to by pull the camera through my pipe, and it would disconnect. I went through about 10 iterations of pairing, disconnecting, pairing, disconnecting before I printed a return label and sent it back. I’ll try something different. I did charge for 24 hours prior to using like the directions suggest.
customer_reviews.author: Smith

customer_reviews.title: Useless Tool!
customer_reviews.text: To say that this tool is useless would be a colossal understatement! A blind man could see better than this POS! Nothing, and I mean absolutely NOTHING comes into any usable focus. Do not waste your money! If you need an endoscope, spring for the more expensive models and shorter video cables. Anything longer than 6 foot is unmanageable.
customer_reviews.author: Coffeethecat

customer_reviews.title: Great for finding Clogs
customer_reviews.text: We had a pipeline clog outside our house, and the plumbers wanted over $200 for just sticking a camera down there and confirming what we thought. So we bought this, and confirmed that the bushes in front of the house we had just purchased needed to go, since the roots were getting in. We could see them just fine. We only wish we had more things to use this for, it's pretty fun!
customer_reviews.author: Clara

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Freezes within 10 seconds every time it connects. Tried rebooting, re-installing, everything. Very frustrating waste of money. Update:The described problem applies to my LG G& thinQ. I then tried it with my old LG V20, and it works fine. I'm still giving it only 2 stars because I bought it for sewer line inspection and the focal length is too long for this--the image is quite blurry most of the time. For other applications it might be quite good.
customer_reviews.author: Greg H.

customer_reviews.title: Camera works good, but ...
customer_reviews.text: Description said for sewer, but I couldn't get it pass the toilet trap on it's own. It's not stiff enough to make it through the toilet trap. I paired it up with a snake, and after may tries, I finally got it to pass the trap. But then after making through the trap it got stuck where the pipe bends. Maybe it will work better if the toilet is removed, but that's another pain to deal with ..
customer_reviews.author: pt

customer_reviews.title: OK. Software app let's the entire package down
customer_reviews.text: The hardware is reasonable and well made and the camera works OK although the focus (close up items) could be better. The main thing that lets the item down is the app required for use. Used the recommended software, free to download but the video file used is not really the type that can be viewed anywhere. So the editing, storage of image files is an issue. Also connection is a little treaky to your phone is a little tricky. OK for occasional DIY use.
customer_reviews.author: D barton

customer_reviews.title: High quality, but takes a bit to get it going
customer_reviews.text: The camera quality and construction seem great. I had to spend about 20 minutes downloading "wifi" software, and trying to get the camera to connect. Since it doesn't connect via bluetooth, you have to disable all your current wifi connections if you're at home or work, and then connect to the WIFI app or through the wifi app. Yes, this is a pain in the arse, but the camera doesn't move when you're moving or pushing the cable, compared to cameras that are plugged into your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Joel S

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME! I needed to check inside a faulty vent and a slow draining drain tile. This camera set up on my iPhone super quick and the picture was very clear. The rigid cable was also very good at bending to check around corners. I was also pleased to learn that the camera could run by being plugged in after battery ran out which was great so I didn't have to wait to recharge to continue my work. While the camera is waterproof I'd still recommend being careful around wet areas as other cameras I have used can develop cloudy lenses after prolonged exposure. I highly recommend this camera!!! It worked great at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: eric f

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with purchase a+++
customer_reviews.text: Very nice endoscope very good quality picture for the price my only complaint was that the directions to get it to connect were a little hard to understand but overall very happy with my purchase for those having issues I will give you some advice Look for WiFi network in your phone Jetion_ xxxxxx Initial password 12345678
customer_reviews.author: Steve6025

customer_reviews.title: This is a great tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool. I used it to fish a few lines, and finally used a few wires to go along the wall, around some obstacles, and I even found and caught a strip of fish with my hook. So I don't have to cut a hole in the wall to mend it. The setup is relatively simple and the picture quality is good. The light at that end is really bright. I was very impressed by the lightness of the camera. Semi-rigid cables are perfect for balancing fishing walls, rotating lines to get through an obstacle and get what you need to see. I haven't used the mirror attachment yet.
customer_reviews.author: Walter R Gozzersing

customer_reviews.title: IT works as advertized.
customer_reviews.text: I does what I intended it to do. It's downfalls are a short range of light and focus. It is not a perfect picture. It is rigid, which makes it easier to push through duct work, but it also makes it difficult to guide around curves. I was cleaning ductwork so I taped it to the vacuum hose which helped as the hose was flexible but kept the camera cable going. It was easy to connect to my I pad. I would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Topping

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool to have
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Blue Fire semi-rigid scope to examine my (rather lengthy) dryer vent. The dryer had not been drying properly but I thought I had cleared the problem. As you can see in the photo, there was a lint blockage in the duct. With the aid of this nifty little camera, I was able to clear the blockage and the dryer is working again! I followed the instructions posted here by another user on how to set up “settings” and the app on my iPhone. Work perfectly the very first try!
customer_reviews.author: Li Con

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Saved me tons on medical bills by doing my own colonoscopy. Found some interesting things up there.
customer_reviews.author: adam b.

customer_reviews.title: Piece of cake
customer_reviews.text: I wish there was a way to change the focus of the camera. The focus distance is from about 3 to 8 cm. Good for close inspection. The LED lights can be controlled by a wheel on the side of the black box at the end of the cable. The wire is stiff enough that is won’t double back on itself. You can straighten it out or put a curve into it to look around corners. It took me a little while get the app to work on my apple devices. I had to select the camera from the settings menu in my iphone and ipad and not in the Wifi View app.
customer_reviews.author: James Woodiwiss

customer_reviews.title: Connects easily to all devices I have tried
customer_reviews.text: Images and video are as described in the sales pitch. Connects easily to all devices I have tried, Multiple Apple and android model phones. Also a plus that I have connect 5 devices to it simultaneously, multiple sets of eyes watching the video feed makes it easier to not miss something. satisfied with purchase. Only minor downer is the supplied attachments aren't very secure, need to use some tape so they don't fall off.
customer_reviews.author: BN

customer_reviews.title: Great View
customer_reviews.text: This camera was very helpful in identifying the objects children throw down sinks, it has a light on the camera that is very bright and allows you to see down the pipes. It emits it’s own WiFi signal that you have to connect to through your phone, which was a little confusing in the instructions, but eventually is figured out. App functions as the viewer, which is all I needed. Does what it’s supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda B Chupp

customer_reviews.title: Don’t try using it on another phone once you get it setup
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of thinking this could be used with another iPhone after I had used it with mine. So now it doesn’t work with any phone now. I’m so disgusted. Then to make it worse the manufacturer changed the way they want you to set it up. I wasted so much time trying to get it to work again to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: LaLaBelair

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a very reasonable price!
customer_reviews.text: Really like this product. Bought it initially for looking up into places I can’t see into on an old boat I’m slowly working on. Wish it had a little more focal length to the camera (you have to get the end very close to what you want to see for a clear picture) but it still has already been a great tool. Very happy with my purchase!!!
customer_reviews.author: JimP

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great for the plumbing issue I needed it for. Because it's a little too flexible, I found it best to zip tie it to a steel drain snake so that it can lead the camera past the turns. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because the instructions for the set up are not very good - the app they mention does not work so I had to find another app. Overall great little tool for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Works Great BUT PAIN TO SET UP
customer_reviews.text: Took me hours to get it working right. Had to find other reviews too see how to do it correctly. Instructions clearly written by someone that does not speak english. But once figure out it worked as advertised and I ran it down my septic drain and low and behold it showed me the problem was ROOTS in my pipes. At least now I know what to do next. But instructions fiasco leaves me no choice but 3 stars at best.
customer_reviews.author: VT Hawaii

customer_reviews.title: seems to work well
customer_reviews.text: The first camera I got wouldn't even turn on. The second one seems to work well so far. The company sent me a replacement right away when I told them the first on didn't work. The camera seems to be sturdy. It works from a wifi signal between it and your phone and uses an app. I haven't used it on the drain I bought it for yet, but I am thinking it will work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: bluefancypants

customer_reviews.title: Still trying to get it to work
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to see inside a 4" round HVAC duct. Having difficulty getting it into the duct but the setup and charging was very easy. Will edit review after I try one last method to get the job done. I will say, the semi-rigid cable is useless when used alone past 5-6 feet and there is no control over the camera and angle it takes. Seems like this is meant to be tied to something more rigid that will also lift it off the bottom of the duct.
customer_reviews.author: Erin A.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: All those things behind the walls, I can see them now. After putting up a wall of tile over pipes I sweated myself, It's nice to have this to see that they're dry. I'd recommend this to anyone wanting to look into that hole. Home improvement uses aside, this thing has so much entertainment potential. I'm looking for holes. Do not spy on your neighbors. That's not right.
customer_reviews.author: 3MTA3

customer_reviews.title: Camera has to be close to subject
customer_reviews.text: I found that the built-in lights are not very powerful, so if you are using this in a dark area, the end of the scope has to be very close to what you want to see. Image quality is decent for the price. I had some trouble with the setup because I didn't realize you have to select the scope in your phone's WiFi settings and make a note of the device name before setting up the app. I returned it, but it might work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Craig P.

customer_reviews.title: Hobby tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for a hobby. I am very curious in life and so I am so curious about anything that catches my attention and things to discover. So this product does whatever my intrigues is telling to do. I use it for anything pretty much that I want to see where I was not aware before. Now if I feel to look into an ants' nest, then I do. This device is very neat and very great to fulfill my curiosities.
customer_reviews.author: Picaflor

customer_reviews.title: Garbage.....DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: After attempting to get this to work some 25 times, I have come to the realization that I was ripped off. This product will not work, followed the directions over and over, looked at the Amazon feedback, looks like I am not alone. Buyers, save your money on this one...get something that works...even if partially.
customer_reviews.author: Old Gaming Dude

customer_reviews.title: A great value!
customer_reviews.text: First of all the camera I received did not come with a charging cable. But I had one that worked so it’s cool. This camera was very easy to set up. It connected to WiFi on the first attempt and maintained the connection flawlessly. The light brightness is adjustable and delivers plenty of light. I needed to look under a slab of concrete that was sinking and sure enough I’ve got a 4” air gap under a walkway. Looks like a leaky sprinkler Is the problem. So far very impressed with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: K1973

customer_reviews.title: Good picture and very handy device
customer_reviews.text: A great tool to have available at home. Originally purchased to figure out where to install recessed light in the subfloor. Wanted to make sure no obstructions before cutting into the drywall. This device did the job, made a small hole and saw where to cut. Later used it for plumbing also.
customer_reviews.author: Sergey

customer_reviews.title: Returned before trying product, review should be discarded, refund easy and instant
customer_reviews.text: The QR code doesn't even bring up a legitimate page. Going to the app store and downloading their app, it won't even open it force closes instantly Updated rating because I returned b4 seeing they sent an email asking me to try a different app, perhaps that would have made it a wonderful product Nothing bad to say, it felt hefty and nice, packed well
customer_reviews.author: doug

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera!!!
customer_reviews.text: We used this recently to check the air Ducts and see if there was something clogging them, because we were getting little heat output. We also used it to check the pool skimmer and see if it had bubbles coming up from a leak- which it did. The picture quality on it is way better than expected. We were really happy we got this because the Home Owner Policy holder wanted to rip open our walls to find the source of the clogged duct. He said finding someone with the camera would cost more. Considering what we paid for it- I highly doubt that!
customer_reviews.author: Denise M. Mcginnis

customer_reviews.title: Priceless When You Need to Use It
customer_reviews.text: The endoscope was easy to get on the phone and the picture was excellent. I use it on carpentry projects. The last use was to fish it up a wall and see what was blocking wiring that I was trying to push to a box on a pre-existing wall. It saved a lot of time. This is the second one that I have purchased. I gave the first one to my father-in-law. He uses it for the same thing. You can't go wrong here.
customer_reviews.author: CBall

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable price, did what I needed it to do
customer_reviews.text: I like being able to view inside of my plumbing with my phone. Not rigid enough to go thru pipes without bunching up. Attach to a snake and works great. Picture quality is good enough to see whats going on. If you get to close it gets blurry. Have to move back and forth to get camera to adjust to be clear picture. Waterproof. Easy setup and app usage. Easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: The Endoscope kit came with instructions (easy to understand if you are familiar with the equipment). I tested it before charging it fully and all worked as it should. Eventually the wifi dropped (even though the light was still on) and the camera image froze. As soon as I charged it fully (less than an hour) it worked perfectly. This is quite handy and easy to use on my iPhone and Galaxy S8 Active.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Freeman

customer_reviews.title: This is so cool! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Pros It's a long and flexible cable There is a light at the end of the camera so you can always see in dark areas The App has a mirror effect so you can flip the image on your phone Cons You can only manually rotate so when you've extended longer there was no way to move the camera Connecting it to WIFI was tricky because it wasn't showing up Didn't come charged so at first I though it wasn't working The Verdict Love it. I had to see through the wall to be able to see where the beams are. This is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Cin

customer_reviews.title: For 40 bucks it’s pretty good - the build quality isn’t great and while ...
customer_reviews.text: For 40 bucks it’s pretty good - the build quality isn’t great and while the camera is waterproof the transmitter is not. While snaking an underground rain drain I got some drain gunk on the transmitter - there was a little puff of smoke and it was lights out - seeing as I though it was dead I took it apart and there is a lot functionality on the board - anyway I found there was mud in the switch and it had melted it! I simply soldered the second and third pin down from the usb end and tada on it came of course I can’t turn it off now but meh the battery only lasts 30-45 min.
customer_reviews.author: Flyinenglishman75

customer_reviews.title: Rating should be a minus 5. Will not WIFI to iPhone SE.
customer_reviews.text: This arrived. Followed directions. Indicators on the Bluefire camera indicate that it is connected to my phone using the WIFI Viewer app, but then gives a message indicating that it can not find the phone. Heed the other's comments and mine and don't waste your money. It's terrible!!!!!! Obviously made substandard in China.
customer_reviews.author: Grammy bear

customer_reviews.title: Poorly built, unusable within months
customer_reviews.text: After about a month and a half, the battery would no longer charge, requiring me to have it plugged in to a power source to use it. A short time later, the mini-USB connection stopped working, so it couldn’t be powered at all. It was totally unusable in fewer than three months.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Use fish tape, works well
customer_reviews.text: Its easy to use, decent picture quality. I had to tape it to an electrical fish tape to get it into the furnace exhaust pipe but it works well for the price. So, the downside is that it is too flexible to push through any non-straight locations and there’s no way you can push it it’s full length by itself. But, it works ok for short runs.
customer_reviews.author: RHPap

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we needed
customer_reviews.text: This item was purchased to help us diagnose an issue with our bathroom extractor fan, it worked straight our of the box. the picture was clear and we could see that the flap between the fan and the tube leading to the outside was not opening. Exactly what we suspected! Going forward, we will be able to use this to help us with our electrical wiring projects, and other detective issues that arise in out 100+ year old house. I will update the review if it stops working in the next few months, but so far we are thrilled!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Lets you check out tight spaces
customer_reviews.text: I've used this to look into drains, pool equipment, and a few other things. It can be somewhat interesting to connect to your phone sometimes, and the picture quality can be difficult - though I believe that's more of an experience thing than a product thing. For a quick look down a tight space - this is a pretty decent tool!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Palkovic

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: It does as it says and is simple to use. If I were to buy again, I would have gone for a smaller size. I am not sure how I can physically use the total length and still have direction control. This brand is great, durable clear and simple, but really think if you need the extra long.
customer_reviews.author: Steve O

customer_reviews.title: Ap install is impossible!!
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t been able to use it! Can’t get the ap to download on my phone. Super difficult. Will return and look for a more user friendly model.
customer_reviews.author: Misty D. Dodson

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Worked once, picture was OK though grainy. Tried to use it again and could not detect the wifi signal no matter what! Attempted this on multiple devices with no luck. Not the first review to experience this, should have listened to those. Now it's been more than 6 months since purchase, so I doubt I'll be getting a replacement or refund. Garbage and a waste of money! Don't bother buying something that works once.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Not for all applications
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use this camera to view down a sewer line, but its to weak and not ridged enough to push down the line. Has a good picture and easy to set up, but it you are trying to push along any distance, this is not the camera for you. Good if its going strait down vertically, but not horizontally.
customer_reviews.author: cesar zuniga

customer_reviews.title: After a year.... Revising my Feedback Upward
customer_reviews.text: Cool tool for the price! I purchased Nov. 2017 and my second use was Sept. 2018...Don't forget the dial for LED brightness! I had forgotten that - an essential setting! Sharpness is better in brighter situations. I would buy it again at $40 in a heartbeat! ...a lens that had more depth of field would be nice, but this is an amazing piece of hardware for the price! BTW - default wifi password is 12345678 (Manual is attached)
customer_reviews.author: S. Giske

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I don't see how people rave about this. Everything is blurry. Would not purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Less than a day, the screen grayed out. Unclear and vague Not what I want
customer_reviews.author: it is awesome by jerry

customer_reviews.title: Great help!
customer_reviews.text: We were installing a reverse osmosis system to our fridge and needed to put in through the floor at an odd angle. We used this to better navigate to find the gap and we hot it right on tge very first try. it saved us time and frustration. Can't wait to find the next use for it. Great durable quality and clear picture.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: It worked great the first time or two. Then the wifi stopped working. Now I have a 30 ft flexible led flashlight.
customer_reviews.author: Möbius Jackson III

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for one that did not work. This one is not bright enough to see. I don't know how this can be used effectively as they claim. Charge lasts 5 minutes. I clearly wasted my money with no option to return.
customer_reviews.author: AJH

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this one
customer_reviews.text: The software for wifi connection is not clear or reliable. Mine worked finally, after two days to trial and error and then the transmitter quit after 15 minutes of use. No support or help available. Skip this one, find a better one. Can someone tell me how to exchange it for one that works? There is no instruction with it about returns.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A.

customer_reviews.title: Very useful tool and priced right!
customer_reviews.text: I am using an iPhone 6S plus, and the image quality is very good. It didn't take but a minute to connect through bluetooth. I have used this to view the vent stack for a bathroom that was having septic tank odors and found an obstruction that was cleared out by running a garden house down the vent stack. I can see using this endoscope for working on other plumbing issues, automotive, and for tracing wiring in my trailers.
customer_reviews.author: G. K. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Money
customer_reviews.text: If you own a cell phone that is current to 5 years old do not bother buying this endoscope! It is not compatible with any newer cell phones. I also came to learn after my purchase that while you have the supposed ability to take still photos and short videos with this camera and software bundled, there is no way in which to share these images. That also defeats the purpose of the entire system. When it looks too good to be true...IT IS! I wish I could have given it ZERO stars or LESS because that is all it was worth. I returned the item for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: SeaCrest

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome. Picture is great
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Picture is great, works on WiFi, LED was adjustable lighting. More than I expected for the money. I bought the 33 foot version and it is rigid enough to do about any job. I am totally satisfied at least so far. I hope it lasts a good while. Oh, and very easy to get up and running on IPhones
customer_reviews.author: Eck

customer_reviews.title: Terrible video quality
customer_reviews.text: The video quality is a joke. Do you remember the first digital cameras from the 90s? It’s just like that. I bought it to look behind walls where it’s dark. The light works fine, but all I see is blurry images.
customer_reviews.author: antonio campos

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: The pictures aren't nearly as clear as I thought they would be but all in all it's a nice item. I basically purchased it as a toy/tool and it's adequate for my purposes. Perhaps I was expecting to much for something this inexpensive so it is a great value for the money. I would recommend it to anyone that didn't need super detailed pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry M.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to pair with a great picture!
customer_reviews.text: The app installed super easy with the QR code and the item paired with my phone flawlessly. When I got the picture I was blown away by how good it actually was. I wasn’t really expecting a good picture, but it was great!
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Good tool to have. I have used it on a couple of sink drains, and even ran it through my HVAC ductwork. Easy to use. Rigid. Stays connected well. Only drawback are the plastic attachments are....well...plastic. Hook broke on first attempt to use to fish out a toothbrush from a drain. Other than that, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Perdue

customer_reviews.title: A good product at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: This camera works fine and it is easy to connect. Like all others of this type, you have to get use to the image, and exactly what you see, which may not be what you are expecting. It is a good camera of its type.
customer_reviews.author: ggg

customer_reviews.title: Look before you drill!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera and easy to use/set up to my iPhone. I use this on the job to check on clogged drains and to have a peek inside walls and ceilings to check on wiring and the such before we start working so we don’t hit anything important or screw into anything we shouldn’t! Great inexpensive product and a handy tool on the jobsite, highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Richie

customer_reviews.title: WI-FI connection sucked, and couldn't get the camera and phone to ...
customer_reviews.text: WI-FI connection sucked, and couldn't get the camera and phone to sync as desired. Decided to save time and frustration and went with a hard wired endoscope with its own camera. Simple, and worked perfectly. This endoscope is HORRIBLE!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PICTURE, EASY TO USE
customer_reviews.text: GREAT PRODUCT SO FAR. WAS EASY TO SETUP. NEEDED TO LOOK DOWN THE TUBE OF AN ARTESIAN WELL. THE PICTURE WAS GREAT, UTILIZED THE BUILT IN LITE, COULD SEE JUST FINE. THE ONLY DOWN SIDE, WHICH IS PERSONAL CHOICE, I WOULD LIKE THE CABLE TO BE MORE RIDGID. THE FARTHER I WENT DOWN THE TUBE, THE HARDER IT WAS TO POSITION THE HEAD. OTHERWISE A GREAT PRODUCT. HAVE NOT USED IN A SUBMERGED ENVIROMENT YET.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Adds a different perspective for photography
customer_reviews.text: Good quality product. Easy to follow instructions. QR code directly takes to App Store. Install the app, connect to this device’s WiFi and you are all set streaming from camera to phone. Yet to explore the photographic possibilities with an endoscope. The variable brightness light at the tip is useful to explore in dark.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to inspect my air ducts in the slab for water. I found the stiffness of the probe beneficial. The picture was clear as long as I kept the camera elevated off the surface. The length of the probe is great. The App hasn’t any bugs or glitches. For what I paid this is a great tool to be used in endless ways. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy V. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I love this endoscope. I started playing with it looking behind dressers and in back of the staircase and this thing works. Told some friends and now we are a recuse mission. We locate the jewelry down the drain, the ring that rolled under the fridge, how far the crack in the wall needs to be filled. This thing is the best!
customer_reviews.author: Jai

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for those hard to see places.
customer_reviews.text: This was an excellent buy. I used it to snake through the dryer vent to check for and lint build up. My landlord had some work done and re-ran the vent duct so it's twice as long and has unnecessary sharp bends. I used the camera to scope after cleaning to make sure I got all of the lint free of the duct. It was easy to set up, easy to use, and I got clear pictures. I'm sure this will come in handy for any number of projects!
customer_reviews.author: meccadavis

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Ran down main sewer line, works great, camera quality is good, was very easy to set up, haven't had an issue with battery life as its never died on me yet, worked perfect for what i needed it for
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: More features for a fraction of the cost
customer_reviews.text: Great improvement over the stand alone endoscopes. I am using an iPad mini for viewing and the detail is outstanding. Originally looking for a self contained unit then started researching and found this one. A fraction of the price with more features. Really like the long flex cable as I am using in to find leaks in a PWC and it is easy to snake deep into the hull. Periscope option and adjustable LED lighting also great features.
customer_reviews.author: John Howard

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't work and a week later after i have returned it still no refund
customer_reviews.author: Ric Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with performance for the price
customer_reviews.text: Ran it down my sewer line due to back ups. Found a piece of concrete left over from construction. The camera kept getting snagged on the pipe joints when trying to feed down. I drilled a hole in a golf ball and super glued it in. No more snags ! Was able to pull out concrete piece by snagging it with the golf ball camera. Took awhile but was cheaper than calling the plumber out to run a camera.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Lee

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: All parts of camera and WiFi system work, albeit with some restarts and reconnects to the signal. Unfortunately camera did not work at all for sewer line inspection. I had only one simple soft curve to navigate in the pipes but the wire and camera kept getting stuck after repeated attempts. Would not recommend for that purpose or any pipe type inspection unless it was one continuous trajectory with no seams or pipe junctions.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Klemp

customer_reviews.title: Garbage camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought camera ..charged it..got the proper app..no image. With closer research on web not on amazon reviewd found its not a good product. Stay away
customer_reviews.author: Rachel75

customer_reviews.title: It's Amazing
customer_reviews.text: It's Amazing how far technology has progressed in such a short period of time, 20-30 years. I have only used this product once thus far, but it worked very well. I am sure I will have other opportunities to use it. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: K. L. Adams

customer_reviews.title: 1 click in app trashes whole device
customer_reviews.text: Cant get phone to connect to the darn thing!! Used to. Now I cant with my new phone. My have accidentally reset the password but what good is an app that easily trashes the device?? Steer clear away from Bluefire!
customer_reviews.author: L. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: JUNK!
customer_reviews.text: Used it once and it wont work anymore. It just flickers and wont display a wifi name. I'm out of the return / exchange period so I guess I just paid for useless junk at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Is water resistant, decent camera, bad battery life
customer_reviews.text: Battery lasts all of 5 minutes completely charged, but the picture is pretty good, and I use it plugged in anyway. Requires a smartphone with Android 4 or higher, and you have to disconnect your data when using the app. I would buy this again for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rayne

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool with many uses - Easy installation.
customer_reviews.text: This nifty little tool is amazing! I am able to look down my air ducts and down in my car engine. Handy tool with great uses. Picture quality is a little bit fuzzy at a distance but otherwise has no problems. Easy installation and easy use.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler K

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: The product works very well. I had a blockage in my drain pipe and the camera showed me what and where it was. The only complaints would be that there are no measurement marks on it to let you know how far in you go and the instructions could be written in better English. When it comes to hooking up to WiFi, go into your phones WiFi, find their WiFi, put in the password 12345678. That will hookup the unit.
customer_reviews.author: liz swanson

product_meta.title: BlueFire Semi-Rigid Flexible Wireless Endoscope IP67 Waterproof WiFi Borescope 2 MP HD Resolutions Inspection Camera Snake Camera for Android and iOS Smartphone, iPhone, Samsung, iPad, Tablet (33FT)
feature_bullets: 【WIDELY COMPATIABLE】 This is the latest wireless endoscope design at the moment, unlike other traditional endoscopes on the market, this wifi endoscope camera can support both Android smartphone(Above Android 4.4) and iPhone IOS system(Above IOS 8.0).

【SEMI-RIGID CABLE】 The semi-rigid cable is great for allowing more control of the direction of the inspection camera, especially as this tool in intended to get into small spaces that would otherwise be near impossible to see.

【HD RESOLUTION CAMERA】 Comes with 2 megapixels CMOS HD camera, 3 adjustable resolution and 6 adjustable LED lights provide HD videos and snapshot images for the snake camera.(Resolution:320x240, 640x480, 1280 x 720)

【WIRELESS】 This wifi borescope has its own Wi-Fi Signal and a build-in Li-lon rechargeable battery, there is no external cable or adapter needed, all you need to do is just to download and install the "WIFI VIEW" app on your smartphone and connect to its WIFI.

【EASY TO USE】 Scan the QR code in the manual to download APP WIFI VIEW, Connect your smart device via WIFI, Open the APP and the live video will show up on the screen. PLEASE DON'T RESET THE WIFI PASSWORD BY YOURSELF, OTHERWISE THE ENDOSCOPE WILL BE USELESS.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars1,047 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
